title: Add risk_filter field to ToolConfig for risk-based tool filtering
description:
**As a** Consoul user
**I want** a risk_filter config option to enable tools by risk level
**So that** I can easily configure "safe only" or "safe + caution" tool sets

**Context:**
Users commonly want to filter tools by risk level (SAFE, CAUTION, DANGEROUS, BLOCKED). Currently, they must list individual tool names in allowed_tools. A risk_filter field provides a simpler alternative for common security postures.

This complements allowed_tools (explicit list) with a coarse-grained filter.

**Technical Notes:**
- src/consoul/config/models.py:1159-1272 - Add new field to ToolConfig
- New field: risk_filter: Literal["safe", "caution", "dangerous"] | None = None
- Uses existing get_tools_by_risk_level() from src/consoul/ai/tools/catalog.py:88-120
- Precedence: allowed_tools > risk_filter > default (all tools)
- If both allowed_tools and risk_filter set, allowed_tools wins
- None = no risk filtering (use allowed_tools or all tools)

Risk levels defined in src/consoul/ai/tools/base.py:30-33:
- SAFE: Read-only operations (grep, code_search, web_search, etc.)
- CAUTION: File operations and command execution
- DANGEROUS: Destructive operations (delete_file)
- BLOCKED: Explicitly prohibited

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** I set risk_filter = "safe" in config
**When** TUI or SDK initializes
**Then** only SAFE risk level tools are registered

**Given** I set risk_filter = "caution" in config  
**When** tools are registered
**Then** SAFE + CAUTION tools are registered (excludes DANGEROUS)

**Given** I set both allowed_tools and risk_filter in config
**When** tools are registered
**Then** allowed_tools takes precedence (risk_filter is ignored)

**Given** I set risk_filter = None (or omit field)
**When** tools are registered
**Then** allowed_tools or all tools are used (backward compatible)

**Testing Considerations:**
- Test each risk level value
- Test precedence (allowed_tools wins)
- Test backward compatibility (None or omitted)
- Validate Pydantic schema
- Test with TUI and SDK

**Implementation Hints:**
1. Add field to ToolConfig:
   ```python
   risk_filter: Literal["safe", "caution", "dangerous"] | None = Field(
       default=None,
       description="Filter tools by risk level. None = no filtering. "
                   "Use 'safe' for read-only tools, 'caution' for safe+caution, "
                   "'dangerous' for all tools. Ignored if allowed_tools is set.",
   )
   ```
2. Update tool resolution logic:
   ```python
   if consoul_config.tools.allowed_tools:
       # Explicit list wins
       tools_to_register = resolve_allowed_tools()
   elif consoul_config.tools.risk_filter:
       # Risk-based filtering
       tools_to_register = get_tools_by_risk_level(consoul_config.tools.risk_filter)
   else:
       # Default: all tools
       tools_to_register = all_tools()
   ```
3. Document in config sample and user guide
4. Update TOML schema examples

**Dependencies:**
- SOUL-154 (Use allowed_tools for registration)

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Implementation complete with TUI-only scope.

**Current State:**
- ✅ risk_filter field added to ToolConfig
- ✅ TUI honors risk_filter for tool registration
- ✅ Precedence logic: allowed_tools > risk_filter > all tools
- ✅ Documentation updated with examples
- ✅ Critical safety fix: empty allowed_tools prevents approval bypass
- ✅ Documentation clarified: TUI-only limitation

**TUI-Only Limitation:**
risk_filter is currently only implemented in TUI (src/consoul/tui/app.py:381-410).
SDK and CLI commands do NOT honor this setting because:
- SDK uses 'tools' parameter in __init__ for tool resolution
- SDK creates standalone ToolConfig, doesn't consult config.tools.risk_filter
- Different architectures = different mechanisms

**SDK Equivalent:**
Users can achieve same functionality in SDK via tools parameter:
```python
console = Consoul(tools="safe")      # Only SAFE tools
console = Consoul(tools="caution")   # SAFE + CAUTION tools
console = Consoul(tools="dangerous") # All tools
```

**Follow-up Work:**
Consider creating ticket for SDK support:
- Option 1: Make SDK consult config.tools.risk_filter
- Option 2: Keep separate (SDK=explicit param, TUI=config-driven)
- Document architectural decision in ADR

**Commits:**
- bc887ee: Initial SOUL-154 (dynamic tool registration)
- 205b033: Fix execution whitelist normalization
- c9dd480: Initial SOUL-156 (add risk_filter field)
- d7f8796: Security fix (don't populate allowed_tools)
- b6460de: Revert (broken - caused approval bypass)
- f8b3829: Critical safety fix (prevent approval bypass)
- e6daa6d: Documentation fix (clarify TUI-only)

comments.content:
Code review completed. Risk-based tool filtering successfully implemented for TUI:

✅ Implementation (c9dd480 + fixes):
- Added risk_filter field to ToolConfig (Literal["safe", "caution", "dangerous"] | None)
- TUI honors risk_filter for tool registration (app.py:395-426)
- Proper precedence: allowed_tools > risk_filter > all tools
- Critical security fix (f8b3829): prevents approval workflow bypass

✅ Security Model:
- risk_filter controls which tools are ENABLED
- permission_policy controls APPROVAL workflow
- Empty allowed_tools prevents auto-approval bypass
- Detailed security comments in code (lines 403-421)

✅ Documentation:
- Clarified TUI-only limitation (e6daa6d)
- SDK equivalent documented: Consoul(tools="safe")
- Configuration examples and guidance

✅ Testing:
- risk_filter="safe" enables only SAFE tools
- risk_filter="caution" enables SAFE + CAUTION
- Precedence works correctly
- Approval workflow not bypassed

All acceptance criteria met. TUI-only limitation documented and acceptable. Ready for production.
